levels.name: Intro
description: Simple to start off. Brush up now, while you can!
Once you click Start, type the result of the displayed format! call as fast as possible. No quotes required - just type the content of the resultant string.
When your answer correctly matches the result, the textbox will go green and the timer will stop. Your best time will be recorded for each level.
(The std::fmt reference might come in handy!)

levels.name: Positional
description: Non-positional parameters are easy, but there's a world of fun to be discovered with positional parameters.
From here on out, each level has several variations that you might be presented. Replay as many times as you want, but pay close attention to the format string and arguments!

levels.name: Positional 2
description: Surely we can't use non-positional and positional parameters in the same format string... right?

levels.name: Padding
description: Strings need room to breathe, too!
Our first taste of formatting parameters.

levels.name: Padding 2
description: Padding wouldn't be all too useful if all we had was left-alignment with spaces. How about we mix it up a bit?
